page.title: 11Father Nicholas Postgate
page.content:
**{The Venerable Nicholas Postgate}** { {Egton Bridge}has strong connections with the{Venerable Nicholas Postgate who was born there, he received his education and was ordained priest at {Douai.
He returned to{England}when he was 32 and after 30 years' work in the countryside of{S.Yorks}he settled at {Ugthorpe}and 20 years later at the age of 82 he was hanged, drawn & quartered at{York}on August 7th 1679.
{Father Postgate}visited a cottage at {Egton,}now called{The Mass House, where in 1930 an oratory was found in the roof set out ready for him to say Mass.
